alert.note: Alert for Eastern San Miguel County; Harding County; Northeast Highlands; Quay County (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 15 at 7:16PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT EAST CENTRAL SAN MIGUEL... SOUTHEASTERN HARDING AND NORTHEASTERN QUAY COUNTIES THROUGH 745 PM MDT... At 716 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Trujillo to 12 miles north of Logan. Movement was southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Logan, Conchas, Ute Lake State Park, Variadero, Conchas Lake State Park, Conchas Dam, Trujillo, Trementina, and Bell Ranch. This includes State Road 104 near Mile Marker 32, and between Mile Markers 34 and 91. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 100 AM MDT for northeastern and east central New Mexico.

area.areaDesc: Eastern San Miguel County; Harding County; Northeast Highlands; Quay County
